abstract: Editorial calls on New York Gov Andrew Cuomo to seriously address fact that state's schools are among the most racially and economically segregated in the nation; outlines obstacles that have created deep inequalities and shortchanged disadvantaged students in New York City and several other cities throughout state; calls for slate of reforms and raft of new investment.
lead_paragraph: The state, which regards itself as a bastion of liberalism, has the most racially and economically segregated schools in the nation.
